intro: Cacalia rufipilis, commonly known as the red-haired cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cacalia rufipilis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
